documents.document: @dedbutdrmng @whimworm They could do a crossover with National Velvet.
@whimworm @dedbutdrmng Shire horses don't have tricks to deal with stairs - unlike daleks.
My Patrons have spoken. This weekend my very first story will be in my next Patreon thingie along with its backstory https://t.co/ogvsSrSwU9
@VictorOcampo Precisely.
@jk_rowling If you ever visit Canberra and need a coffee from another writer, I will make you one, as thanks for the glory of that exchange.
This helps show the difference between what's happening in the US and what needs to happen in the US. https://t.co/mPBvR1TYXW
@NITV @AnitaHeiss This man is one of my personal heroes.
@staticsan Right now, in my fridge there's a vegie curry, much pasta sauce, fruit compote, pickled mushrooms and home made chocs.
@staticsan It means I have too much food. I was ill for so long, I'd forgotten and now i have too much food, always.
@staticsan My autopilot ends up in food cooked. I go in to get a coffee or wash dishes and more food is cooked.
@VictorOcampo With knitting needles. We need a Doctor who knits.
@Airstrip_0ne If I share it, they get to judge. This is fair, for stories are for readers, not writers.
Should I give my Patreon people my very first ever published story, in all its ordinariness? They deserve better, but that's not the point.
@Bridgeman_Books The bok chapter is all done. The course is always fun to teach. The rest... it all depends! It's a strange Thrones year.
@Bridgeman_Books I'm doing a re-watch for my year looks a bit Game of Thrones ish (an article I've written, a course I'm teaching etc)
@MerriamWebster People have been reading the news today.
@matociquala Either that, or they're using a not-real-example as a smokescreen.
First Dog talks to those outside Australia: https://t.co/9wdUliXv4T
@enoughsnark If I can help, then let me.
@enoughsnark I can't do cute, but if I can help in talking, ring me. I have this strange past...
@DannyDangerOz When someone doe something like this, the real show's elsewhere.
And more reading: https://t.co/6FRvuDkpy4
I'm reading: https://t.co/PJDZlzpuUg
@AustFiction This will never be me. I predict it.
@GillianPolack @_thisisourdream Thank you for the RT (BTW, very auspicious date of birth - only the select few share in it)
@melkettle @WritersCentreAU Mozzies are evil. We need a mozzie army for our enemies. Except we have no enemies, just the mozzies.
@WritersCentreAU @melkettle Drown that mozzie in it
@GillianPolack @jeannette_ng Thank you for the RT :)
@kmjgardiner It's a lot of fun. I change the actual periods taught to meet the specific interests of students, which keeps it fresh for me,
@melkettle @WritersCentreAU If you liquefy enough salt, you can put up an "Inland Sea" sign and sell tickets to tourists.
@GillianPolack @kmjgardiner Thank you for the RT :) - I'll see you at the HNSA, I hope!!
@WritersCentreAU In Canberra it's so hot and sticky that if I pour sugar into a pile it'll turn into toffee right there on my kitchen bench.
@aliettedb I could do a basic workshop for @worldcon75 with a bit of help from locals to source taste-stuff. If people wanted it...
@aliettedb My students will get cook-at-home recipes and group tastings (only if they want! they almost always want...).
. @jolantru Thank you for the RT :). This one looks as if it might actually go ahead. After last year, I wondered.
Why don't I ever remember to say that my food history course isn't specifically for writers, just useful to them? https://t.co/YQSLVDH924
Taste history & argue about its flavours. Writers who asked me about food history for worldbuilding, this is it! https://t.co/YQSLVDH924
Only a few more places left in my ANU evening course about writing novels (and editing them, and marketing them!): https://t.co/Qmb7c8aBAF
@amisamileandme That's a very concise and almost attainable schedule.
@Chadwickauthor I was impressed they let the ad run, given someone like me was sure to see it and misinterpret :)
I'm putting together my reading from last year, for my Ditmar nominations and I read almost no Australian short fiction! This is not good.
I just received an ad telling me of the great new holidays available in the USA. "Terms and conditions apply."
I'm taking refuge in books tonight. Georgian books. My friends on Patreon will find out what this is about next weekend, all going well.
@dedbutdrmng I'm being beaten at the typo stakes!
Mr Turnbull is more informative right now on what isn't part of his job than what is. Leadership belongs in one of those two categories.
@RoseLemberg wise child
@TinaMakereti This is excellent news :)
@aliettedb Also, Alma Alexander's (and twitter didn't force a link on me there!)
@TheKooriWoman I love it that you actively support freedom of speech not being freedom to hurt. I'm sorry it's family, though. That sucks.
@randomisalex She would've emailed you to say your nom of Paul came through.
This is true of so many critical issues,. We lack leadership, common sense, humanity and dignity. https://t.co/6qQPsWqcBS
@ann_leckie Supporting industry groups and special interest groups also helps, for one of the problems the US faces is big money arguing.
@RoseLemberg Thinking of you!! And worried for so many of my friends.
@bogiperson Am thinking of you. If I can help, let me know.
@jennybel75 Thank you! And the trivium one is fine. And we *so* need to catch up!! If you're likely to be in my vicinity sometime hoy me.
@randomisalex https://t.co/HhqBlCWIvh It's this.
@jennybel75 If it's low in saturated fat, I'd love it - thank you!!
DUFF is open for voting! Help send the marvellous @PrinceJvstin (Paul Weimer, of @SkiffyandFanty ) to Continuum!!!
@randomisalex Lucy H. (who made the DUFF announcement). If you have trouble getting through to her, let me know and I'll email her privately
@dancinghorse It's a terrifying mess. Keep doing what you can, when you can - every bit helps, even if it doesn't feel that way.
@aliettedb My history side produces quite different experiences to my SF side. I'm very lucky to have both!
@PrinceJvstin Thank you for the RT, kind sir!
I'm in some amazing company in September: https://t.co/8TI0XUuptm Phryne Fisher fans, please note.
@enoughsnark It's hard, though. One of the things I've done over the years is teach people not to self-reject. I can't seem to teach myself.
@ian_sales Check the NF&SA online. If they have it, I can get it for you
@enoughsnark Too often those who speak up are already-seen folks who see a gap, or majority culture folks who miss what's happening.
@enoughsnark An important thing is how many of us assess ourselves and step back, to let others in. It's something I've seen. A bit mixed.
@enoughsnark I keep on thinking "I'm not marginalised" - when I am, but there are others who are more disadvantaged. I'll have a think.
@ian_sales I need to find out from you what Aussie stuff you have, for I live near the National Film & Sound Archive and they have a shop.
@enoughsnark it's my pleasure. I don't know if I've got anything to submit to the antho, but I so want to see it see light of day!
Read the whole story... https://t.co/y0FzATnMrI
@jennybel75 That looks so yummy! My mind can't take it in cos my place smells of the pasta sauce I've been making
@ian_sales Wonderful! (including the cat)
@jasefranks @starrybryte @continuum_con is so going to rock!!
Visual storytelling - an online masterclass with Jason Franks (read his Sixsmiths!): https://t.co/cyMaVFL3sU
@dancinghorse It did some good - some people are prepared. Without the warnings, there would be weeks of stunned silence. Dangerous weeks.
There are good things. The New Year is one of them. My singing is not. Have someone singing for me: https://t.co/K3QBIfdlWt Gong Xi Fa Cai!
Something cheering (thanks Sharyn!): https://t.co/JFQl3ONBeo
@dancinghorse Suddenly those 20 years of activism weren't wasted. I'd rather they had been.
@dancinghorse I seem to spend a lot of my recreational time teaching people the basics of political action these days.
@dancinghorse No-one should hurt. Not even kids who threw stones at me or adults who lost me my APS career because I'm Jewish. No-one.
@dancinghorse This is where being Jewish in a country where we're a minority is handy. I know a lot of useful things, from experience.
@dancinghorse All we can all do now is continue to fight & to make sure other people are OK. Get through the mess as intact as possible.
@dancinghorse The theory was fine - but the reality of it hurts so many people, every day.
@jendowli It's going to significantly interfere with US business. As it did last time. And reduce tourism to the US. Again.
@TheKooriWoman Oh, damn. I hope you reach the actual debt-free stage SOON. I'll party online with you when that happens.
@jendowli US visas used to be such a pain to get, so this is a return to old ways.
@jeffvandermeer I only read up to the first bracket. Then I skipped to the second line. (I blame the heat wave.)
@dancinghorse He doesn't care about the violence, does he? What a piece of work is that man.
@TheKooriWoman That's wonderful!!
I'm just going to put this one up here (she's no relation, for those who are curious): https://t.co/MbJkUe5V2m
@daggyvamp @tintinaus Death in fiction can (only sometimes) be, a type of exorcism. I don't really want to exorcise my friends..
@tintinaus @daggyvamp In fact, any number of people who want to be forgettable non-entities can donate to GUFF and I'll make a list...
@tintinaus @daggyvamp That'd be a specific kind of novel. I'd love to see if there were any takers to be forgettable non-entities in novels.
For all my friends who knit, Icelandic wool indiegogo: https://t.co/HhnZAwbZ79
@tintinaus @daggyvamp Maybe. Or maybe I'll kill of people who annoy me.
@tintinaus @daggyvamp That sounds like a hint!
Vote! Help choose the Australasian delegate for @worldcon75 in Helsinki! https://t.co/p7lCvEFzmE
@enoughsnark It's the only way
@enoughsnark Very oddly, my scholarly book is easier to read than my fiction. What does this say about me? I possibly don't want to know.
